page.title: 03A Wigan Walking Day
page.content: On Sunday 2nd June St. Mark's Church had their annual walking day. We all had to meet at l.30 p.m. We had our walking day clothes on which had been made specially for the occasion. At 2.00 p.m. the procession moved off. In the procession were people involved with St. Marks Church as well as two brass bands who played as we walked. We walked round the parish and back to church where a short service was held. On the 16th and 17th June, St. Williams Church in Ince had a Walking Day. Two other churches also took part, Belle Green Methodist and Ince Parish Church. St. Williams is a Catholic church and used to have a Walking Day of its own until it was abandoned about twenty years ago. This year will be the first time that the three different churches have got together for a Walking Day.
